data.title: 2024 Florida Grapefruit League Schedules Available
data.text:
Florida Grapefruit League Travel and Promotion Tips

By Nick Gandy, Florida Sports Foundation

As we prepare for Day One of the 2024 Florida Grapefruit League season, here’s a word to the wiser of the Baseball Fans heading out to one of 13 Florida locations between February 24 and March 26.

There’s a fun promotion at a lot of the ballparks and there’s some ways to look at the more than 200 game schedule and find some interesting ways to see MLB’s finest Under The March Sun.

Here’s something you’ll find with a deep dive into the 2024 Schedule. We’ll begin with what I’ll call a “Trifecta Days Trip.”

While there’s not too many of them this year, it’s a team hosting games on three successive days.

From March 9 – 11, the Houston Astros host the Washington Nationals, Miami Marlins and Detroit Tigers on those three days at the Cacti Park of the Palm Beaches.

March 23 – 25 finds the Pittsburgh Pirates hosting the Boston Red Sox, New York Yankees and Toronto Blue Jays at LECOM Park in Bradenton. That’s a must-see for fans of the American League East.

It’s not three consecutive days, but for those in the Clearwater area between March 21 – 25, the Philadelphia Phillies host the Tampa Bay Rays March 21 and 25, the Detroit Tigers, March 22 and the Toronto Blue Jays, March 24. Four games at Baycare Ballpark in five days.

Here’s some interesting weekend tour dates in some of the more populated Florida Spring Training areas, the weekend of March 1-3.

Try this trio of games in the Tampa Bay area. Friday, March 1, Miami Marlins at Philadelphia Phillies at Baycare Ballpark in Clearwater. Saturday, March 2, Atlanta Braves at Toronto Blue Jays at TD Ballpark in Dunedin. Sunday, March 3, Detroit Tigers at New York Yankees at George M. Steinbrenner Field.

More of the same in the Fort Myers area. Friday March 1, Boston Red Sox at Minnesota Twins at the Lee Health Sports Complex. Saturday March 2, Boston Red Sox at Tampa Bay Rays at the Charlotte Sports Complex, in Port Charlotte. Sunday March 3, Toronto Blue Jays at Boston Red Sox at Jet Blue Park.

Onto the East Coast. Friday March 1, New York Mets at St. Louis Cardinals at Roger Dean Chevrolet Stadium. Saturday, March 2, St. Louis Cardinals at Houston Astros at the Cacti Park of the Palm Beaches. Sunday, March 3, Miami Marlins at Washington Nationals at the Cacti Park of the Palm Beaches.

Just a few ways to maximize the number of teams to see in a few days. Isn’t that what it’s all about?

That and fun promotions. Speaking of which, here’s a few to look for. Check your favorite team’s schedule to see what else is available throughout the season.

2024 Florida Spring Training Promotion Days

Baltimore Orioles

Saturday, February 24 – 2024 Schedule Magnet

Friday, March 8 – Orioles Spring Training t-shirt

Sunday, March 17 – Rally Towel

Friday, March 22 – Orioles cap

Saturday, March 23 – Fireworks

Various times throughout the month – Seniors (60 and over) stroll the bases

Boston Red Sox

Sunday, February 25 – Jimmy Buffett Margaritaville Day, with live music

Monday, February 26 – Red Sox Hawaiian Shirt

Thursday, February 29 – Reversible Bucket Hat

Saturday, March 2 – Have a Catch on the Field

Minnesota Twins

February 24, 28; March 3, 20, 26 – Senior Days (Ticket Specials for 55+ fans)

February 27; March 3, 4, 16, 22 – Salute to Service Days (Ticket specials for active military, first responders, veterans, police officers, EMTs, firefighters and teachers)

Pittsburgh Pirates

February 25; March 3, 10, 16, 17, 23, 24 – Kids Run The Bases

February 25; March 3, 10 – Pirates Alumni Autographs on the concourse in right field.

March 5 – Senior Expo and Tote Bag

March 10 – LECOM toothbrush

Toronto Blue Jays

Saturday, February 24 – Blue Jays Hawaiian Shirt

Enjoy the season and be on the lookout for more Florida Spring Training tips throughout the season.
